metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8821 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Tor before 0.2.5.16, 0.2.6 through 0.2.8 before 0.2.8.17, 0.2.9 before 0.2.9.14, 0.3.0 before 0.3.0.13, and 0.3.1 before 0.3.1.9, an attacker can cause a denial of service (application hang) via crafted PEM input that signifies a public key requiring a password, which triggers an attempt by the OpenSSL library to ask the user for the password, aka TROVE-2017-011. It was discovered that Tor incorrectly handled PEM input. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2
tor-geoipdb - 0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tor package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.9.14-1ubuntu1~16.04.2').
